data.sentence: The word يَوْمٍ comes from the root ي و م and is associated with the meanings: day, era, time, today, this/that day, age/period of time.

data.meanings: great, important, big, regard, honour, mighty, glorious, a man of moment, All-mighty, All-glorious, grievous, bounty/abounding, magnify/increase. azzama - to make great

data.meanings: chastisement, castigate, punishment, torture, torment, retribution, abstain/desist, relinquish, quit.adhb - sweet (usually water), e.g. 25:53, 35:12.
data.sentence: The word عَذَابُ comes from the root ع ذ ب and is associated with the meanings: chastisement, castigate, punishment, torture, torment, retribution, abstain/desist, relinquish, quit.adhb - sweet (usually water), e.g. 25:53, 35:12.

data.meanings: To meet or touch or feel a thing with the hand, touch a thing without intervention or interference, strike or smite, afflict or befall, be distressing or difficult of accomplishment.
data.sentence: The word تَمَسُّوهَا comes from the root م س س and is associated with the meanings: To meet or touch or feel a thing with the hand, touch a thing without intervention or interference, strike or smite, afflict or befall, be distressing or difficult of accomplishment.

data.meanings: to treat badly, do evil to disgrace, be evil/wicked/vicious, ill, anything that makes a person sad and sorrowful, bad action, mischief and corruption, sin, evil doer, wretched or grievous, vex, annoy. su'atun (pl. suat) - corpse, external portion of both sexes, shame.
data.sentence: The word بِسُوءٍ comes from the root س و ا and is associated with the meanings: to treat badly, do evil to disgrace, be evil/wicked/vicious, ill, anything that makes a person sad and sorrowful, bad action, mischief and corruption, sin, evil doer, wretched or grievous, vex, annoy. su'atun (pl. suat) - corpse, external portion of both sexes, shame.
